dd.p: This section provides an overview of the features of the MIS 3287 Connector. It introduces:
It also discusses a feature that lets you use existing LU names in a 3270 environment.
3287 is the protocol between a host running a MVS (Multiple Virtual Storage) operating system and a printer.
The MIS 3287 Connector uses the Telnet version of 3287, TN3287. To use this connector, you must either have a:

ul.li: module on the host that converts 3287 into TN3287, or a
gateway between this connector and the host that performs the same task

dd.p: Two types of data stream are supported:
Two types of output are available:

stentry.msgph: Though the 3287 protocol delivers every type of binary flow, only the PCL (Printer Control Language) type is supported with this version.

dd.p: The use of LUs (Logical Units) that are associated with 3270 equivalents is permitted.

stentry.msgph: 3270 is the protocol for communication between a host running an MVS and a terminal.
